name: ListScheduleOverrides
description:
Retrieve list of schedule overrides for a time range.

Use this tool to get a list of schedule overrides for a given time range, which indicates when users are On-Call. OAuth with 'schedules.read' scope is required.

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.description: The start date of the range for searching schedule overrides. Format: YYYY-MM-DD.

value_schema.description: The start of the date range over which you want to search.

parameters.name: end_date_range
parameters.description: The end date for the search range in 'YYYY-MM-DD' format. Specifies the last day to include in the results.

value_schema.description: The end of the date range over which you want to search.

parameters.name: resource_id
parameters.description: The ID of the schedule resource to fetch overrides for.

parameters.name: accept_header_versioning
parameters.description: Specify the versioning format for the API response using the Accept header.

value_schema.description: The `Accept` header is used as a versioning header.

parameters.name: content_type_header
parameters.description: Set the 'Content-Type' header to specify the format of the request body. Typically 'application/json'.

parameters.name: return_only_editable_overrides
parameters.description: Set to true to return only future editable overrides, providing only their IDs.

value_schema.description: When this parameter is present, only editable overrides will be returned. The result will only include the id of the override if this parameter is present. Only future overrides are editable.

parameters.name: allow_overflow
parameters.description: Set to true to allow schedule entries that extend beyond the date range bounds without truncation.

value_schema.description: Any on-call schedule entries that pass the date range bounds will be truncated at the bounds, unless the parameter overflow=true is passed. This parameter defaults to false.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the Pagerduty API.

parameters.name: since
parameters.description: The start of the date range over which you want to search.

value_schema.description: The start of the date range over which you want to search.

parameters.name: until
parameters.description: The end of the date range over which you want to search.

value_schema.description: The end of the date range over which you want to search.

parameters.name: editable
parameters.description: When this parameter is present, only editable overrides will be returned. The result will only include the id of the override if this parameter is present. Only future overrides are editable.

value_schema.description: When this parameter is present, only editable overrides will be returned. The result will only include the id of the override if this parameter is present. Only future overrides are editable.

parameters.name: overflow
parameters.description: Any on-call schedule entries that pass the date range bounds will be truncated at the bounds, unless the parameter overflow=true is passed. This parameter defaults to false.

value_schema.description: Any on-call schedule entries that pass the date range bounds will be truncated at the bounds, unless the parameter overflow=true is passed. This parameter defaults to false.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: The `Accept` header is used as a versioning header.

value_schema.description: The `Accept` header is used as a versioning header.

secrets.description: The OAuth token to use for authentication.
